subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: From {{och-l|家|home, house}}, with the addition of the denominal verbalisation suffix *''-s'' in Old Chinese, meaning “to go to one's new home; to become married”. In the Baxter–Sagart system, an additional pronunciation is posited for the causative sense (“to make someone become married; to [[marry off]]”), formed with the prolific Old Chinese causative prefix *''s-''. Compare {{zh-l|*娶}}.
